title: The Defaced Portrait
setting: Hawthorne & Associates Law Firm, main hallway, Tuesday 7:30 AM
premise: The oil portrait of the firm's founder was vandalized with a marker mustache and horns overnight. The portrait hangs in a hallway with no security camera coverage.

suspects.name: Beth Calloway
suspects.motive: The founder's grandson, a senior partner, just blocked her promotion
suspects.alibi: I left the office at 6 PM and went to a bar review study group at the downtown library. We studied until 10 PM. There were eight of us and the librarian saw us leave.

suspects.name: Oscar Delgado
suspects.motive: Asked for a raise three times and was denied each time by management
suspects.alibi: I was cleaning the building from 10 PM to 6 AM like every Monday night. I started on the fourth floor and worked my way down. I cleaned the hallway around 3 AM.

suspects.name: Victor Haines
suspects.motive: Openly despises the firm's old-fashioned culture and calls the portrait 'pretentious'
suspects.alibi: I was at home all evening watching the football game. It was the Monday night game, Lions versus Packers. The game ended around 11:30 PM and I went to bed right after.

suspects.name: Rita Saunders
suspects.motive: Blamed the founder's legacy policies for the firm's strict and outdated dress code
suspects.alibi: I left at 5:30 PM and picked up my kids from daycare. We had dinner at home, bath time, and I was in bed by 9 PM. My husband was home all evening with me.

clues.title: Marker Evidence
clues.content: The marker used was a thick black Sharpie. A matching uncapped Sharpie was found in the janitor's supply cart on the second floor, with ink still wet on the tip.

clues.title: Cleaning Route Records
clues.content: Oscar's electronic check-in system shows he logged the hallway floor as cleaned at 3:05 AM. At that time the portrait would have been right in front of him.

clues.title: Monday Night Football Schedule
clues.content: The NFL schedule confirms there was no Monday night football game this week. The Lions versus Packers game was played on Sunday afternoon, not Monday night.

hints.text: Check whether each alibi references an event that can be independently verified.
Was there really a football game scheduled for Monday night this week?
